business.headline: Move out of comfort zone: Uday Kotak warns businesses as rupee hits record lowRecent comments by Uday Kotak highlight the effects of foreign investor actions on the Indian stock market, with Indian investors responding as buyers amid international exits.
Sensex, Nifty recover to end higher as IT stocks lift marketsThe S&P BSE Sensex added 158.51 points to close at 85,265.32, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 47.75 points to end at 26,033.75.

New rent rules for 2025: Will tenants finally get a fair deal?High rental deposits often force families to block large sums of money for years. The new 2025 rules hope to fix that. An expert breaks down how these changes could reshape renting and strengthen household finances.

India's economy is booming, but why is the rupee tumbling?India's economic growth is surging, yet the rupee keeps weakening as global risks rise and dollar demand expands. Why is a growing economy unable to prevent its currency from sliding further?

IBM CEO Arvind Krishna explains why tech layoffs have increasedIBM itself announced plans this year to cut thousands of jobs as it shifts focus to areas like artificial intelligence consulting and software.

Tier-2 cities and women investors drive India's crypto boom: ReportIndia's crypto landscape is changing fast, with Tier-2 cities and women investors emerging as the strongest new drivers of growth, according to a new report.

Investing Rs 5,000 in mutual funds? Why you should not go for multiple SIPsAre you planning to start investing with a Rs 5,000 SIP and thinking multiple funds will give you better diversification? Expert says this common approach may actually weaken your long-term returns. Here's how.

Are real estate investments outpacing stocks? Study points to 15% returnsA new study suggests that Indian residential property delivered 15% returns over the past year, surpassing many equity portfolios and challenging popular narratives about real estate's investment value.

Rs 30,000 crore IPO wave is coming in December. What should investors knowDecember includes large names such as Meesho, ICICI Prudential Asset Management Company (ICICI Pru AMC), Clean Max Enviro Energy Solutions, Fractal Analytics, Juniper Green Energy, and several mid-size and SME firms.

Will gold hold above Rs 1.30 lakh? Here's what experts sayGold prices in India remained stable as traders waited for the outcome of the US Federal Reserve meeting, with attention on both international and local drivers amid market volatility.

Aequs IPO: Check latest subscription details, GMP and moreThe grey market premium for the Aequs IPO is currently around Rs 45.5. Based on this, the estimated listing price works out to approximately Rs 169.5, implying potential listing gains of about 36.69% over the upper end of the price band.

Having undisclosed foreign income? Why is CBDT urging taxpayers to review ITRsThe CBDT has launched the second NUDGE campaign, contacting taxpayers who have not disclosed foreign income or assets, and setting a deadline of December 31 for revising Income Tax Returns to avoid penalties.

Applying for Meesho IPO? Investors should be aware of these red flagsThe IPO will close on December 5 and the allotment will be finalised on December 8. Meesho is set to list on the BSE and NSE on December 10.

PwC India flags tax shortfall but says FY26 fiscal deficit still on trackWhen the government presented the FY26 Budget earlier this year, it expected gross tax revenue to touch Rs 42.7 lakh crore. PwC now believes the final number will be closer to Rs 40 lakh crore, signalling a shortfall of nearly Rs 2.7 lakh crore.

Sensex opens 100 points lower, Nifty below 26,000; HUL down 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was up by 110.14 points as it recovered to 85,216.95, while the NSE Nifty 50 added 41.15 points to 26,027.15 as of 9:39 am.

Meesho vs Aequs vs Vidya Wire: Which IPO offers the best value?Meesho IPO was subscribed 2.46 times on Day 1, with retail investors bidding 4.13 times their quota. Aequs saw even stronger retail interest at 12.16 times, pushing its overall subscription to 3.56 times. Vidya Wires, a smaller issue, was subscribed 3.16 times overall.
1,232 IndiGo flight cancelled in November, aviation regulator probesThe Directorate General of Civil Aviation sought reasons from the airline over the cancellations of flight and delays in time.

EPFO ends Aadhaar–UAN extension: Will employers now face stricter ECR rules?EPFO confirms there will be no further deadline extensions for Aadhaar seeding with UAN, affecting ECR filing from November 2025.
Sensex, Nifty close flat as falling rupee sparks concern on Dalal StreetThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 31.46 points to close at 85,106.81, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 46.20 points to end at 25,986.00.

Transferring money to family to save tax: Smart move or legal risk?On the surface, it looks like easy tax efficiency. But experts say that while transferring money within the family is legal, using it as a tax-saving tool is far more complicated and can even invite scrutiny if not handled correctly.

entertainment.headline: Sonam Kapoor recalls Anand Ahuja's New York proposal on 8th engagement anniversary Sonam Kapoor looked back at her 2016 New York engagement to Anand Ahuja, as the couple prepare to welcome their second child. She shared a throwback picture from eight years ago, marking the occasion.

Shehnaaz Gill says she's treated like a prop in Hindi films Shehnaaz Gill, known for her rise after Bigg Boss 13, has shared insights on her transition to film production, the challenges she faced in Bollywood, and her renewed focus on Punjabi cinema.

Dharmendra's 90th birthday tribute: Deol family likely to open farmhouse to fans Actors Sunny and Bobby Deol, joined by their families, are reportedly set to mark Dharmendra's 90th birth anniversary at his Khandala farmhouse. They are likely to open the gates to fans, allowing them to pay their respects to the late actor.

Palak Muchhal breaks silence on Palaash-Smriti Mandhana wedding being put on hold Singer Palak Muchhal opened up about the emotional challenges the families are facing after the wedding of cricketer Smriti Mandhana and her brother Palaash Muchhal was put on hold.

Madhuri Dixit breaks silence on whether her marriage with Dr Shriram Nene was arranged Madhuri Dixit has revealed about her marriage to Dr Shriram Nene, whether it was arranged or not. She emphasised that true happiness comes from personal relationships, valuing her husband and family as her greatest blessings over fame or accolades.

Diljit Dosanjh tells the story of one shot in Chamkila that broke him. Video Diljit Dosanjh discussed his experience portraying Amar Singh Chamkila in the biopic following his Emmy nomination. He shared personal insights and gratitude for the late artist.

Bhay The Gaurav Tiwari Mystery teaser: Karan Tacker, Kalki lead paranormal series The teaser for Bhay – The Gaurav Tiwari mystery was unveiled today. The series highlights the paranormal investigator's life and mysterious death.

Tu Meri Main Tera title song uses Saat Samundar beat without permission: Rajiv Rai Filmmaker Rajiv Rai has objected to the alleged use of the iconic opening beats from his 1992 film Vishwatma's Saat Samundar in the teaser for the upcoming Kartik Aaryan and Ananya Panday film 'Tu Meri Main Tera Main Tera Tu Meri', set for release on December 25.

Amitabh Bachchan shares a painful experience from Khaike Paan Banaras Wala in Don Amitabh Bachchan shared the challenges he faced during the filming of the classic song 'Khaike Paan Banaras Wala' from the film Don, revealing details about repeated takes and the physical toll of chewing paan multiple times.

JioHotstar this week: The Bad Guys 2, Dies Irae and more This week, JioHotsar offer a diverse lineup featuring coming-of-age drama, horror thrillers, action-packed sequels, and family mysteries. From Griffin in Summer to Dies Irae and The Bad Guys 2, viewers can pick from feel-good stories to dark, gripping worlds.

Kriti Sanon's sister Nupur to marry Stebin Ben in January, venue not finalised Kriti Sanon's sister Nupur Sanon is reportedly set to marry singer Stebin Ben in January. While Udaipur is being considered, the family is exploring multiple venues before finalising details.

Jaya Bachchan on most disturbing phase of her life: Couldn't stop crying Jaya Bachchan opened up on one of the most difficult periods of her life at a recent session in Mumbai. The veteran actor and politician spoke about the phase when she couldn't stop crying.

Honour, privilege: Emotional Agastya Nanda recalls working with Dharmendra in Ikkis At the music launch of Ikkis, actor Agastya Nanda became emotional while discussing Dharmendra's involvement in the film and the family connection across generations.

Prime Video, ZEE5 and Sony LIV: Thamma, Kuttram Purindhavan and more This week, Prime Video, ZEE5, Sony LIV and MX Player bring a mix of horror-comedy, emotional dramas and intense thrillers. From supernatural stories to campus romance and gripping investigations, there's something for every kind of viewer.

Balakrishna hopes Akhanda 2 teaches Sanatana Dharma, celebrates Chennai roots At a Chennai event, Nandamuri Balakrishna shared his views on the upcoming film Akhanda 2, emphasising its role in imparting lessons of Sanatana Dharma to the current generation, and spoke about his personal and familial connection to Chennai and Tamil Nadu.

Waah Indigo waah: Elvish Yadav slams airlines amid massive nationwide delays IndiGo's massive cancellation of nearly 200 flights has thrown airports across India into chaos, leaving passengers stranded and frustrated. Elvish Yadav also expressed his frustration about the ordeal.

When Karisma Kapoor kept shooting for Biwi No. 1 despite her metal dress injury Karisma Kapoor sustained an injury while filming a song for Biwi No. 1, but insisted on completing the shoot the same day despite discomfort. Costume designer Ashley Rebello recalled the incident in an interview recently.

Scarlett Johansson in talks for The Batman 2 as Zoe Kravitz exits as Catwoman Scarlett Johansson is in talks to join The Batman Part II, marking a notable addition to the DC universe as filming is set to begin next spring. The sequel, directed by Matt Reeves and starring Robert Pattinson, will see a change in the cast with Zoe Kravitz unlikely to return as Catwoman.

Samantha's mehendi pics are a tribute to simplicity and Raj's silent love language Fresh images from Samantha Ruth Prabhu and Raj Nidimoru's wedding events in Coimbatore emerge online as friends and family share heartfelt posts.

general news.headline: Live: Vladimir Putin lands in Delhi, PM Modi receives him in break with protocolRussian President Putin in India Live Updates: Russian President Vladimir Putin is set to begin his two-day state visit to India in just a few hours for the 23rd India-Russia Annual Summit, with his arrival in New Delhi expected in the evening. During the visit, Putin will hold talks with Prime Minister Narendra Modi, focusing primarily on trade, investment, economy and defence. President Droupadi Murmu will also receive him and host a state banquet. He is likely to be accompanied by senior officials from the Russian government as well as leading figures from the country's business community. Stay tuned with India Today for all Live Updates.

PM Modi receives Putin at Delhi airport in rare diplomatic gestureRussian President Vladimir Putin is on a two-day state visit, his first since 2021, coinciding with the 25th anniversary of the India-Russia strategic partnership. Several key agreements are expected during the summit.

Couldn't live up to promise: IndiGo CEO apologises over chaos in letter to staffIndiGo CEO apologised after hundreds of flights were cancelled, delayed, leading to massive chaos on airports across cities over the last three days.

PM Modi not one to give in to pressure: Vladimir Putin to India TodayIn a major world exclusive, Russian President Vladimir Putin spoke to India Today Group's Anjana Om Kashyap and Geeta Mohan at the Kremlin ahead of his historic visit to India.

Do you have any regrets? Putin said this to India Today's Editor-in-ChiefIndia Today got a glimpse of one of the world's most scrutinised leaders when the group's Editor-in-Chief, Aroon Purie, and Vice Chairperson and Executive Editor-in-Chief, Kalli Purie, interacted with the Russian President in Moscow ahead of his India visit.

Is tradition broken with no Opposition-Putin meet? A look at previous visitsAhead of Russian President Vladimir Putin's visit, Rahul Gandhi accused the Narendra Modi government of breaking an old tradition of inviting foreign dignitaries on state visits to meet Opposition leaders.

India's economy is booming, but why is the rupee tumbling?India's economic growth is surging, yet the rupee keeps weakening as global risks rise and dollar demand expands. Why is a growing economy unable to prevent its currency from sliding further?

Taliban erect Greater Afghanistan map with parts of Pakistan on poet's graveThe Taliban have placed a "Greater Afghanistan" map, depicting parts of Pakistan as Afghan territory, on Pashto poet Matiullah Turab's grave. This comes amid a fragile ceasefire and escalating cross-border tensions between the neighbouring countries, and could be seen by Islamabad as an act of provocation.

Raj Nidimoru's ex-wife Shhyamali says no to drama after his marriage to SamanthaShhyamali De broke her silence with a note three days after ex-husband Raj Nidimoru married Samantha at the Isha Yoga Center. She thanked well-wishers and firmly said she wasn't seeking drama or attention.

Visiting dignitaries' call: Government sources on Rahul Gandhi's Putin meet chargeDismissing Rahul Gandhi's claims, government sources clarified that it is up to the visiting delegation to organise meetings with opposition leaders and that the Centre has no role in it.

Retired? Pakistanis poke fun at Asim Munir as appointment suspense drags onAsim Munir: In technical terms, Pakistan is currently without a serving army chief or a Chief of Defence Forces in place. The new CDF post would have made Asim Munir the most powerful man in Pakistan. But, the Sharif government has not issued a notification yet.

Over 200 IndiGo flights cancelled today, total chaos at airportsThe Directorate General of Civil Aviation has called IndiGo officials for a meeting amid ongoing operational disruptions causing flight cancellations and delays.

Tell my boss to not fire me: IndiGo flyer's plight mirrors thousands' todayDespite repeated pleas at help desks and boarding gates, many IndiGo passengers claimed they were left without any staff support or announcements even as flights continued to be cancelled or delayed for hours.

Exclusive: Just two friends in a car, says Putin on viral carpool with PM ModiIn a major world exclusive, Russian President Vladimir Putin spoke to India Today Group's Anjana Om Kashyap and Geeta Mohan at the Kremlin ahead of his historic two-day state visit to India.

Why question Deoband visit? Taliban leader slams Pak PM, asserts right to India tiesAfghanistan's acting Foreign Minister Amir Khan Muttaqi asserted Taliban-led Afghanistan's right to trade and political rights to ties with India. Pakistan has been critical of Delhi-Kabul relations. Muttaqi also rubbished Islamabad's allegations of Indian-backed militancy in Balochistan.
I am a doctor and here's what I know how older adults can prevent fallsA geriatrician shares her experience with older patients about healthy ageing - physically, mentally, and emotionally.

Last supermoon of 2025 to rise tonight. Why you should not miss itThe second-biggest and second-brightest full moon of 2025 rises tonight as the Cold supermoon. Catch this jaw-dropping sky giant low on the horizon right after sunset across India.

Khaleda Zia to be flown to UK; BNP, AL to be without top leadership in BangladeshKhaleda Zia, Bangladesh's ailing former PM and BNP chief, will be flown to London for advanced treatment, her party said. The move comes as the 80-year-old battles critical heart and lung infections in Dhaka, leaving the BNP without its top leader ahead of the promised crucial election in February.

Putin arrives in Delhi today: BrahMos, S-500 air shield, trade deals in focus Live UpdatesRussian President Vladimir Putin arrived in Delhi on Thursday evening for a two-day state visit, his first trip to India since the start of Moscow's war in Ukraine and his first since 2021. The visit, extended at the invitation of Prime Minister Narendra Modi, comes as the two nations mark 25 years of their strategic partnership and hold their 23rd bilateral summit.

Samantha's mehendi pics are a tribute to simplicity and Raj's silent love languageFresh images from Samantha Ruth Prabhu and Raj Nidimoru's wedding events in Coimbatore emerge online as friends and family share heartfelt posts.

Amitabh Bachchan shares a painful experience from Khaike Paan Banaras Wala in DonAmitabh Bachchan shared the challenges he faced during the filming of the classic song 'Khaike Paan Banaras Wala' from the film Don, revealing details about repeated takes and the physical toll of chewing paan multiple times.

Matthew Hayden doesn't have to run nude, thanks to Joe Root's maiden ton Down UnderAshes 2025-26, 2nd Test: Matthew Hayden's bold take finally came to fruition as Joe Root went on to score his maiden Ashes hundred in Australian soil, leaving the legendary Australian batter relieved that he did not have to run buck naked.

Techie dies by suicide, cites harassment by neighbours, civic staff in noteA software engineer in Bengaluru died by suicide at his under-construction building after alleged harassment by two relatives who demanded Rs 20 lakh. His mother's complaint alleges they involved BBMP staff to pressure him. Police registered an FIR against the accused.

S-500 on India's radar: How this missile can hit satellites in spaceThe S-500 represents a leap beyond the S-400, with a 600 km range for ballistic targets and interception altitudes up to 200 km, reaching low Earth orbit (LEO).

Sonam Kapoor recalls Anand Ahuja's New York proposal on 8th engagement anniversarySonam Kapoor looked back at her 2016 New York engagement to Anand Ahuja, as the couple prepare to welcome their second child. She shared a throwback picture from eight years ago, marking the occasion.

Shehnaaz Gill says she's treated like a prop in Hindi filmsShehnaaz Gill, known for her rise after Bigg Boss 13, has shared insights on her transition to film production, the challenges she faced in Bollywood, and her renewed focus on Punjabi cinema.

sports.headline: Dewald Brevis's Raipur special amazes Pretoria Capitals coach Sourav Ganguly Former India captain Sourav Ganguly said Pretoria Capitals are particularly excited about securing Dewald Brevis's services for the long term. Ganguly praised the young South African after he lit up Raipur with a blistering knock that played a key role in one of the most remarkable run chases ever seen on Indian soil.

Root vs Starc's magical tussle sets tone for gripping Pink Ball Test in Gabba Ashes: A gripping battle between Joe Root and Mitchell Starc set the tone for what could turn out to be a defining Test match at the Gabba. The duo headlined Day 1 of the 2nd Test where the teams traded blows in a see-sawing game.

Mark Wood casts doubt over return in Adelaide Test after painkilling injections Mark Wood has cast doubt on his availability for the third Ashes Test in Adelaide, citing ongoing knee trouble. The England fast bowler, who only recently returned from surgery, said he is more likely to be fit for the Melbourne or Sydney Tests after undergoing painkilling injections and spending time in a knee brace.

Matthew Hayden doesn't have to run nude, thanks to Joe Root's maiden ton Down Under Ashes 2025-26, 2nd Test: Matthew Hayden's bold take finally came to fruition as Joe Root went on to score his maiden Ashes hundred in Australian soil, leaving the legendary Australian batter relieved that he did not have to run buck naked.

Meet Sarwagya Singh Kushwaha: A 3-year-old chess prodigy with a FIDE ranking Three-year-old Sarwagya Singh Kushwaha has become the youngest player ever to earn an official FIDE rating, rewriting chess history with his extraordinary achievement. His rapid rise and victories over international opponents have stunned the chess community.

Ashes: Joe Root breaks curse, hits maiden Test hundred in Australia Ashes 2025: Joe Root finally broke his century drought in Australia with a superb maiden hundred at the Gabba, rescuing England from an early collapse. His innings delivered the stability and intent England needed amidst a batting collapse.

Hardik Pandya fan craze triggers SMAT venue change as crowds overwhelm organisers Hardik Pandya's return to domestic cricket sparked unprecedented fan chaos in Hyderabad, forcing officials to shift Baroda's SMAT match to a larger venue. His comeback has reignited excitement and raised expectations ahead of India's T20 assignments.

How does the World Cup 2026 draw work? A look at how 48 teams will be grouped The FIFA World Cup 2026 draw is all set to take place at the Kennedy Center in Washington, D.C, on Friday, December 5. Here's a look at how the draw will take place and how the teams will be grouped.

RoKo's future being decided by people who have not achieved much: Harbhajan Singh IND vs SA: Harbhajan Singh's pointed remarks questioning those deciding Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma's futures have reignited debate within Indian cricket. His comments land amid rising rumours of tension involving head coach Gautam Gambhir and the senior duo.

Starc breaks Wasim Akram's record, becomes left-arm pacer with most Test wickets Mitchell Starc went past Wasim Akram to become the left-arm pacer with the most number of wickets in Test cricket history.

DSP Richa Ghosh begins duty as ACP Siliguri after World Cup success After playing a key role in India's World Cup triumph, Richa Ghosh starts her new journey in uniform as ACP Siliguri, taking up duties soon after receiving her DSP appointment.

Ruturaj Gaikwad for 2027 ODI World Cup? R Ashwin urges long run for CSK captainIND vs SA: Ruturaj Gaikwad's first ODI hundred has sparked fresh debate about India's batting order, with Ashwin saying the team must find space for him even when Shreyas Iyer and Shubman Gill return.

Irfan Pathan blames Ravindra Jadeja disappointing knock for Raipur lossIND vs SA: South Africa beat India on Wednesday, in the 2nd ODI of the series. Irfan Pathan blamed India's death overs batting for the loss despite the hosts hitting a total of 358 runs.

Why Cameron Green's IPL 2026 bidding war can't cross Rs. 18 Crore markCameron Green is expected to live the millionaire dream during the IPL 2026 auction, with many teams interested in him. However, the all-rounder cannot be sold for more than Rs. 18 Crores.

Age does not matter till Rohit, Kohli continue performing with bat: Tim SoutheeIND vs SA: Tim Southee feels that age does not matter for Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma till they keep contributing runs in ODI cricket. Southee believes that India should carry the greatest ODI player of all time to the ODI World Cup 2027.

Mumbai Indians acquire Oval Invincibles in the Hundred, new name revealedReliance Industries, owners of the Mumbai Indians, and Surrey County Cricket Club have entered a partnership, officially announcing the renaming of the Oval Invincibles franchise to MI London in The Hundred.

Rohit Sharma's eyelash falls, Pant's has the most millennial reaction everIND vs SA: Wicketkeeper Rishabh Pant and opener Rohit Sharma shared a hilarious moment in India and South Africa's 2nd ODI match in Raipur. The incident sparked massive nostalgia amongst the millennials.

Premier League: Arsenal grind out Brentford win, Chelsea suffer shock lossArsenal reinforced their position at the top of the Premier League with a disciplined win against Brentford, extending their unbeaten run. Chelsea, meanwhile, suffered a home defeat to Leeds United, slipping further behind in the title race.

A Virat Kohli ton finally isn't enough: India's 7-year unbeaten ODI streak endsVirat Kohli's superb 102 in Raipur could not save India, who suffered their first ODI defeat with a Kohli century in nearly seven years. His stand with Ruturaj Gaikwad set up 358, but South Africa chased it down to level the series.

What Gautam Gambhir told Ruturaj Gaikwad after giving No.4 role? India batter revealsIndia batter Ruturaj Gaikwad revealed the message he got from Gautam Gambhir after being told to play the role of No.4 during the South Africa ODIs. Gaikwad hit his maiden ODI hundred during the match in Raipur.

2nd Test, Day 1 highlights: England on 325/9 as Root's hundred keeps Australia at bayAUS vs ENG, Ashes 2025, 2nd Test Day 1 Highlights: Joe Root posted a long-awaited first Ashes century in Australia to give England the honors on Day 1 despite Mitchell Starc's six wickets.

Finisher who? Raipur loss highlights India's glaring ODI weaknessSouth Africa's record chase of 359 exposed India's inability to push harder with the bat in the death overs. Hundreds from Virat Kohli and Ruturaj Gaikwad went in vain with at least 20–30 runs left on the field in the first innings.

Leader and mentor: Virat Kohli's double role in Raipur earns praise from GavaskarVirat Kohli did more than score runs in the Raipur ODI. He steadied a nervous Ruturaj Gaikwad after a brutal first-ball bouncer from Marco Jansen, helping him settle before he struck his maiden ODI hundred. Sunil Gavaskar praised Kohli's leadership and mentorship during the key partnership.

Jadeja the culprit? KL Rahul admits late-overs slump as India fail to defend 359IND vs SA, 2nd ODI: South Africa's record chase exposed India's lack of a finishing kick and the impact of relentless dew, prompting KL Rahul to admit his side left crucial runs on the field in Raipur.

Virat Kohli, Ruturaj Gaikwad tons not enough as SA chase 359 in dewy RaipurIndia vs South Africa, 2nd ODI: South Africa scripted the joint-highest successful chase by a visiting team in ODIs in India when they gunned down 359 on a dewy evening. India finished second-best in Raipur despite hundreds from Virat Kohli and Ruturaj Gaikwad.

Sports Minister leads talks to end Indian football impasse, confronts AIFF on issuesSports Minister Mansukh Mandaviya met AIFF officials, club representatives and prospective bidders to address Indian football's financial and structural crisis. He questioned leadership lapses, heard stakeholder concerns and promised a plan to end the ongoing stalemate.

Smoke shisha, talk cricket: MS Dhoni's open-door CSK routine revealed by ex-teammateMichael Hussey lifts the lid on MS Dhoni's relaxed and welcoming team culture at CSK, sharing stories of open-room hangouts, shisha sessions and Dhoni's surprising lack of keeping practice.

Irritated by media attention, Stokes snaps at Aussie reporter over e-scooter rowAshes: A tense standoff unfolded between Ben Stokes and a reporter in Brisbane after the England captain and teammates were questioned about not wearing helmets while riding e-scooters.

Aiden Markram first visiting SA opener to hit hundred vs India in a decadeAiden Markram scored a superb 110 to become the first South African opener in ten years to make an ODI century in India. His dismissal marked a turning point as India regained control in a high-scoring match.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
